definition: abbr. for the Big Dipper constellation 北斗星[Bei3 dou3 xing1]
to fight/to struggle/to condemn/to censure/to contend/to put together/coming together
dry measure for grain equal to ten 升[sheng1] or one-tenth of a 石[dan4]/decaliter/peck/cup or dipper shaped object/old variant of 陡[dou3]
to consider/to deliberate/to fill up a cup to the brim

sentences.english: He filled [poured] another cup of wine for me.
Brandy is poured over the pudding, then lit.
sentences.chinese: 白兰地斟在布丁上，然后点燃。

sentences.english: It's far trickier, for example, to serve beer than wine.
sentences.chinese: 比如，斟啤酒要比斟葡萄酒棘手得多。

sentences.english: It's far trickier, for example, to serve beer than wine.
sentences.chinese: 比如，斟啤酒要比斟葡萄酒棘手得多。

sentences.english: I've fully brimmed a glass with wine for him.
sentences.chinese: 我为他满满当当斟了一杯酒。

sentences.english: A cup of tea , afternoon , listen to the weather.
sentences.chinese: 斟一杯淡茶，坐一个下午，倾听天气。

sentences.english: He filled my cup but not overbrimmed.
sentences.chinese: 他给我斟了满满一杯酒，却没让酒溢出。

sentences.english: The host filled Mr. White a bumper.
sentences.chinese: 主人给怀特先生斟了一满杯。

sentences.english: The man poured a full glass of whisky, and set down the bottle noiselessly .
sentences.chinese: 那人斟了满满的一杯威士忌，轻轻地放下瓶子。

sentences.english: Verily, glass vessels overflowed with nectar and amber cups brimmed with ambrosia.
sentences.chinese: 琼浆满泛玻璃盏，玉液浓斟琥珀杯。

definition: to fill up (a wine glass) to the brim
to pour wine/to drink wine/to deliberate/to consider
to enjoy a cup of wine by oneself
to drain the cup in one gulp (idiom)
